data.event: In a tribute to Gadhimai, a Hindu goddess of power, a Nepal festival began today with the mass sacrifice of 20,000 buffalo in the village of Bariyarpur.
Member of Parliament Shiv Chandra Kushwaha skipped Tuesday's legislative meeting, saying that the festival had more importance as a religious celebration.
Although animal rights groups have condemned the ceremony as cruel, the Nepalese government has ignored requests to cancel the festival, held once every five years.
Last year, the government banned a similar slaughter during the festival of Yanya Punhi, and was greeted with angry protests.
